roleset.name: (cause to) become hot or hotter
roleset.note: HEAT-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of Vncls cooking-45.3, other_cos-45.4. (from heat.01-v)
HEATING-N NOTES: Corresponds with heat.01. Framed by anwen april 2011 (from heating.01-n)
HEATED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, heat-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls cooking-45.3, other_cos-45.4. (from heated.01-j)

example.name: all arguments
example.text: You-1 can go only up or down ( by [*-1] heating the balloon 's air with a propane burner , which does make the top of your head feel hot ) and ride the air currents .
example.arg: with a propane burner , which does make the top of your head feel hot

example.text: Todd's careless heating of the leftover bouillabaisse gave him food poisoning.

example.name: physical heat
example.text: The outdoor swimming pool was heated and immaculately clean.

roleset.name: make hot or hotter
roleset.note: HEAT_UP-V NOTES: frames created by Olga. No Vncls for the VPC, but see other_cos-45.4, cooking-45.3. (from heat.02-v)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Competition in the sale of complete bikes is heating up too .
example.arg: Competition in the sale of complete bikes

roleset.name: attractive, stylish, desirable
roleset.note: HOT-J NOTES: Added by Julia. (from hot.03-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: she is so hot she doesn' require music.

roleset.name: emotionally agitated
roleset.note: HOT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6. Relation to heated.02. (from hot.02-j)
HEATED-J NOTES: Added by Julia. Relation to hot.02. (from heated.02-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: For a time , online discussion was hot , and people refused to yield even an inch , with a great tendency to making a gigantic issue out of it .

example.name: arg1
example.text: Dad gets all hot and bothered if someone parks in his parking space.
example.arg: if someone parks in his parking space

example.name: arg1
example.text: things are so heated between us , I do n't know what to do .

roleset.name: having a high temperature
roleset.note: HOT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6, heat.01. (from hot.01-j)

example.name: Don't tag empty weather 'it'!
example.text: How to Have Fun When-1 It's Hot Outside [*-1].

example.name: arg1
example.text: It has a fan that automatically comes on, once the fireplace is hot and turns off when it is cold.
